intro: Xanthophyllum borneense, commonly known as the Bornean goldenleaf, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Borneo. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow-green leaves and showy, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in lowland rainforests and is often found in secondary vegetation. It has small, inconspicuous flowers that are surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
